title: Mexican Rice and Beans Recipe
description: This Mexican beans and rice recipe is an easy vegetarian dish with poblanos, basmati rice, and pinto beans seasoned with paprika, oregano, and cumin.

About Us The Allrecipes Allstars How to Add a Recipe GET THE MAGAZINE Never lose a recipe:¬†Join MyRecipes to save and find favorites from AR & beyond Recipes Main Dishes Rice Beans and Rice Recipes Mexican Rice and Beans 4.4 (42) 34 Reviews 7 Photos This Mexican beans and rice recipe is spicy and delicious. Submitted by Afzal Najam Updated on November 13, 2024 Tested by Allrecipes Test Kitchen Tested by Allrecipes Test Kitchen The Allrecipes Test Kitchen staff are a team of culinary pros who make and vet recipes using only equipment you'd find in a home kitchen. Staff credentials vary but include training at the Culinary Institute of America; kitchen stints in fine dining restaurants; and countless hours in the test kitchen itself. Meet the Allrecipes Test Kitchen Save Rate Print Share Close Add Photo 7 7 7 7 Prep Time: 5 mins Cook Time: 25 mins Additional Time: 5 mins Total Time: 35 mins Servings: 4 Jump to Nutrition Facts Cook Mode (Keep screen awake) Ingredients 1x 2x 4x Oops! Something went wrong. Our team is working on it. Original recipe (1X) yields 4 servings 2 tablespoons olive oil 1 small onion, diced 1 small poblano pepper, diced 1 clove garlic, chopped 1 cup basmati rice 2 teaspoons paprika 1 teaspoon ground cumin 1 teaspoon dried oregano salt and ground black pepper to taste 2 tablespoons tomato paste 2 cups vegetable broth 1 (14 ounce) can pinto beans, rinsed and drained Directions Heat olive oil in a medium pot over medium-high heat. Cook and stir onion, poblano pepper, and garlic in hot oil for 2 to 3 minutes. Add rice and cook, stirring occasionally, until rice is completely coated in oil, about 2 minutes. Season with paprika, cumin, oregano, salt, and black pepper. Stir in tomato paste and cook for 1 to 2 minutes. Add vegetable broth and pinto beans. Bring to a boil; reduce heat to low. Cover and simmer until rice is tender, 15 to 20 minutes. Remove the pot from the heat, keep covered, and let stand for at least 5 minutes. Fluff with a fork. Recipe Tip You can use green bell pepper instead of poblano and chicken broth instead of vegetable broth. Add Your Photo Photos of Mexican Rice and Beans 01 of 07 Photo by¬† Allrecipes Member 02 of 07 Photo by¬† CaringRoast3453 10/18/2023 This was delicious! I actually cooked the rice first separately and added it after the spices, etc. I also added an extra half portion of rice and the same of spices/paste because I felt that there were too many pinto beans otherwise. I also used padr√≥n peppers because there were no poblanos in my supermarket. Have already sent the recipe on to my four very impressed friends ü´∂ 03 of 07 Photo by¬† CYNDI 09/15/2023 Yum!! My only variation was an added jalape√±o. 04 of 07 Photo by¬† mad91224 06/13/2022 We loved this recipe! It was slightly sticky maybe because I only had tomato sauce instead of paste. But the favor was fabulous. It will become a staple in this house. 05 of 07 Photo by¬† rolland 10/23/2021 So Good, thanks for the recipe. I had no idea of the ingredients involved. The Vegetable broth and tomato paste were great to work with. 06 of 07 Photo by¬† Thomas Nace 05/06/2021 Happy Cinco de Mayo!! I made this for lunch today with the following substitutions: 1 - I used red onion, 2 - I only had white rice, 3 - I did not have any tomato paste, I used a mix of Sriracha, Hoisin Sauce, Tabasco Sauce, and olive oil, 4 - I did not have Poblano peppers, I only had serrano or jalapeno peppers. so I used two Serrano peppers, several tines spicier. 5 - To the spice blend I added a dash of cayenne and chili pepper powder and used No Salt (salt substitute), 6 - I prepared fresh dried pinto beans instead of canned. 7 - When complete I topped with fresh chopped Parsley and Cilantro. It came out good, spicy as well. 1 You‚Äôll Also Love Cuban Beans and Rice 218 Ratings Vegan Red Beans and Rice 3 Ratings Green Lentils and Rice Assyrian Style 24 Ratings American-Style Red Beans and Rice 73 Ratings Instant Pot Vegan Tex-Mex Bowls 3 Ratings Mexican-Style Pinto Beans 7 Ratings Vegan Burritos 2 Ratings Quick Black Beans and Rice 301 Ratings Plant-Based Taco 3 Ratings Mexican Pasta 333 Ratings Quinoa Black Bean Tacos (Vegan) 38 Ratings Vegan Sweet Potato and Bean Burritos 5 Ratings Vegan Bean Taco Filling 434 Ratings Vegetarian Red Beans and Rice 2 Ratings Vegan Black Bean Quesadillas 91 Ratings Full-of-Veggies Burritos 2 Ratings Allrecipes Newsletters Follow Us Dinners Meals Ingredients Occasions Cuisines Kitchen Tips News Features About Us Editorial Process Privacy Policy Product Vetting Terms of Service Advertise Careers Contact Your Privacy Choices ¬† Allrecipes is part of the Dotdash Meredith¬†publishing¬†family. name: Afzal Najam
instructions: Heat olive oil in a medium pot over medium-high heat. Cook and stir onion, poblano pepper, and garlic in hot oil for 2 to 3 minutes. Add rice and cook, stirring occasionally, until rice is completely coated in oil, about 2 minutes. Season with paprika, cumin, oregano, salt, and black pepper.;Stir in tomato paste and cook for 1 to 2 minutes. Add vegetable broth and pinto beans. Bring to a boil; reduce heat to low. Cover and simmer until rice is tender, 15 to 20 minutes.;Remove the pot from the heat, keep covered, and let stand for at least 5 minutes. Fluff with a fork.
